Wilmington.Wesleyan Female College (Wilmington):
Wesleyan Female College of Wilmington, Delaware was a college for women located in the United States that operated from 1837 to 1885.


== History ==
Reverend Solomon Prettyman founded the institution in 1837 as the Wesleyan Female Seminary, with the support of the Philadelphia and Baltimore Conferences of the Methodist Church. In 1841 the school was chartered under the name of "Wesleyan Female Collegiate Institute." By 1842, it had 111 students and nine instructors.
